questions.question: Does a dog make a ……………………….. pet than a cat?
questions.description: Use a comparative adjective before than.

questions.question: The pessimism in his writing is …………………………… depressing.
questions.description: We use too to talk about undesirable extremes.

questions.question: She takes a perverse delight in disagreeing ………………………… everyone.
She is perfectly capable ………………………… care of herself.
questions.description: We use of + ing form after capable.

questions.question: She makes ……………………………. visits to the beauty parlor.
The library subscribes to scores of ……………………………….
……………………………. hardships, she persisted in her efforts to get a college education.
He jumped up, ………………………….. his hat and ran to the bus stop.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we usually use a past tense in the subordinate clauses as well.

questions.question: This belt won’t go …………………………… my waist.
During a gasoline shortage, big cars ………………………… a glut on the market.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.
